title: why does Ekko have a passive on his W?
body:
passive: Ekko's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage versus targets below 30% of their maximum health. 

^ that's on his W. The amount of stuff this guy has in his kit, what was the point of throwing ANOTHER passive on him. RIOT please

What was Kayle's weakness? What was Annie's weakness? Because some of the simplest champs have practically no weaknesses. Did you know Amumu has typically been the highest winrate jungler for years, yet he's one of the oldest champs? "Having no weaknesses" doesn't just depend on the abilities of the champ. It also depends on their cooldowns, mana costs (or lack of), range, and damage. 

Thresh has many weaknesses. His hook opens him up to retaliation, since he drags himself to the enemy instead of dragging them to him. Conversely, Blitz's hook is weaker against initiators, since you don't want to drag an amumu into your team. He has practically no burst damage. His range is bad. He has no sustain. It's interesting to note that being a ranged initiator makes relic shield suck pretty badly on him, compared to the typical melee champs you see bot lane. Why? Because he can't execute minions, so he relies on E to get last hits. If you use the passive portion of E to lasthit minions, you won't be using it to harass the enemy. On the other hand, coin / spellthief don't offer the survivability he needs, so he's in a place where there really isn't a great support item for him. 

Ekko's strong weaknesses are: his incredibly crappy damage scaling on his basic abilities, his requirement to land melee attacks (which opens him up for retaliation) to do most of his damage, his lack of reliable CC (his W has a 3 second delay, his Q can easily be walked out of), and his subpar burst compared to other assassins.

LeBlanc's strong weaknesses are her lack of AoE (she has to use her escape to waveclear, which leaves her open to ganks / harass), her lack of CC (she just has a delayed root, many mages have stuns or silences, viktor has both for example), her complete lack of sustain, and the fact that she's practically useless if she doesn't do well early. I don't really consider Leblanc's kit overloaded, anyway. She's fairly simple to use / play.

> Thresh has many weaknesses. His hook opens him up to retaliation, since he drags himself to the enemy instead of dragging them to him. 

No his hook does not, he has the option of throwing himself at the enemy but thresh is able to hook someone and walk the other direction while pulling them. He is also able to freely use his other abilities during this time.

> He has practically no burst damage. His range is bad. He has no sustain. 

Not having burst isn't a weakness, his AA is ranged along with a hook to bring him to people or bringing them to his team. Not having sustain is not a weakness, majority of champions do not have any sustain, and thresh is capable of dealing a of damage.

> It's interesting to note that being a ranged initiator makes relic shield suck pretty badly on him.

Also not a strong weakness, never had a problem, or seen a problem of people using the relic shield on him.

You need a happy middle. I wish people wouldn't pretend the game has to be either 125 overloaded kits or 125 braindead kits - there are so, so many champions who are in between the two extremes of difficulty. No, I don't think anyone wants a game where everyone is Annie, but that shouldn't mean everyone has to be Ekko either and up until very recently it didn't. Riot didn't just go from making incredibly simple champions to incredibly complex ones over night - over the last few years we've gotten some amazingly crafted champions with lots of room for skill expression without being overloaded and that's the sort of thing I think we should go back to. 

I watched LCS last night and in a particular game there was Gnar, Azir, Kalista, Rek'Sai and Bard. Literally the 5 most recently released champions in one match and every one of them is among the very strongest of their roles in competitive play. I don't want champs to be needlessly simple - nobody needs another Annie. But I wish every newly released kit wouldn't include everything a champ could possibly want in their respective roles. I miss when champions had weaknesses.

The AP scaling and number of things in his kit means he rarely has to use it all to kill or make someone have to flee. The passive is stupid, the double dash is stupid, the stun plus massive shield is stupid and his ult.... stupid. He is far, far too strong and frankly I'm sickened that if anything it'll be at least a month before they deliver any meaningful nerfs. Until then blind pick games will be a nightmare of Ekko players where your team has the bad one and the other team has the one able to fully abuse his kit.

Another utility champion (not assassin) is Orianna. Her ult is 150, 225, 300 +70% AP. Her shockwave can be flashed out of relatively easily. Ekko's ult is 200, 350, 500 + 130% AP. It also heals him and makes him invulnerable during activation and it's a lot quicker than Orianna's ult. I know, assassin vs mage so yes damage blah blah. That is just his ult and it can affect multiple people without any decrease in damage for additional targets hit or healing done.

He isn't hard to play and even bad players (I'd throw myself in that pile) can do a lot of damage very easily. There is no way that this champion will be allowed in LCS in his current state. I know he can't be used yet but they are usually a patch or two behind and I can see him being the new perma-ban.
Orianna can control where her ult goes off, and has really strong CC tied to it, which in and of itself makes up for the difference.

His issue isn't his kit, it is his numbers.  His numbers are a bit overtuned across the board, but a few small taps should fix it up.

1.  His mana cost on his abilities are near non-existant if not talking about Q.   Ekko has a decently hard time going OoM because of this.  This means more timewinders to dodge (his only real high costing ability) and more dashing around for him.  His ult doesn't even cost mana for some reason.  No clue why, but it doesn't.
